dataset.title: NOAA 6-Minute Tidal Heights for Wachapreague, VA, 1996-2000 and 2005-present

metadataProvider.organizationName: Virginia Coast Reserve Long-Term Ecological Research Project

address.deliveryPoint: Department of Environmental Sciences, University of Virginia, 291 McCormick Road, PO Box 400123

abstract.para: Data is 6-minute interval predicted and observed tide levels at NOAA/NOS/CO-OP station 8631044, Wachapreague, Virginia. Station is operated by the Virginia Institute of Marine Science (VIMS) Eastern Shore Lab.

Data were acquired from the NOAA/NOS Center for Operational Oceanographic Products and Services (CO-OPS) web site (http://tidesandcurrents.noaa.gov/) for station ID 8631044 (Wachapreague, Virginia) using the CO-OPS API for data retrieval. Separate comma-delimited files were retrieved for predicted and observed water level data, one month of data per file, and the data combined using R.

The UVA grants you (hereafter, Licensee) a license to use the data and documentation for academic, and research purposes only, without a fee.

send to the address, above, two reprints of any publications resulting from use of the data and documentation.

section.para: Any Licensee wishing to make commercial use of the data and documentation should contact the UVA, c/o VCR/LTER, to negotiate an appropriate license for such commercial use. Commercial use includes

listitem.para: integration of all or part of the data and documentation into a product for sale or license by or on behalf of Licensee to third parties, or
distribution of the data or documentation to third parties that need it to utilize a commercial product sold or licensed by or on behalf of Licensee.

section.title: Methodology:
section.para: Current sensor and measurement metadata for all CO-OPS stations, and the Wachapreague station in particular, can be found at:

section.title: Data Quality Notes from NOAA:
section.para: It was found towards the end of 1999, that the water level station was experiencing silting and mud accumulation causing the dissemination of bad water level data. As a result, the data from 2001-10/2005 were not of good quality and found unusable. The data for this early time period have been purged from the record and are currently unavailable. The station was removed and relocated in 11/2005.

Unfortunately, the same data quality concerns from 2001-2005 continued through to 2009. There is some verified water level data available during the 2005-2009 time frame, but very little. For this reason, data from this later time period are flagged as being of â€œpreliminaryâ€ quality only.
Wachapreague, VA (Station ID: 8631044) water level data has had many issues through the years, but data from 2010-present has been better than previous years.

dataTable.entityDescription: NOAA 6-Minute Tidal Heights for Wachapreague, VA, 1996-2000 and 2005-present

attribute.attributeLabel: Date and Time (Greenwich Mean Time) in “YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm” date and time format
attribute.attributeDefinition: GMT_DATETIME - Date and Time (Greenwich Mean Time) in “YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm” date and time format

textDomain.definition: Date and Time (Greenwich Mean Time) in “YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm” date and time format

attribute.attributeLabel: Predicted Astronomical Tide (meters) relative to local mean sea level
attribute.attributeDefinition: PTIDE - Predicted Astronomical Tide (meters) relative to local mean sea level

attribute.attributeLabel: Observed Tide (meters) relative to local mean sea level
attribute.attributeDefinition: TIDE - Observed Tide (meters) relative to local mean sea level

description.para: The Observed Tide is the Mean Tidal Level of the 181 one-second water level samples collected during the 3 minutes centered on each 1/10th of an hour. It is the recalculated value after having omitted those one-second values that exceed the three sigma criteria.

Sigma is the Standard Deviation of the 181 one-second water level samples collected during the 3 minutes centered on each 1/10th of an hour. It is the recalculated value after having omitted those one-second values that exceed the three sigma criteria.

The outlier flag is set for the given 6-minute interval water level data point when the associated incoming outlier value (number of individual one-second sensor measurements which were omitted for averaging because they exceeded the three sigma criteria) is greater than the allowable outlier threshold value determined for this station.
Flat Limit for water level exceeded.
Rate-of-change limit for water level exceeded.
Limit Flag: either the minimum (low) or maximum (high) expected water level limit was exceeded.
Verified data has passed the National Ocean Service's QA/QC checks and meet the criteria and standards of official NOS data.

Statement for preliminary data: "These raw data have not been subjected to the National Ocean Service's quality control or quality assurance procedures and do not meet the criteria and standards of official National Ocean Service data. They are released for limited public use as preliminary data to be used only with appropriate caution."
